item.title: ROCKSTEADY ROCK MY SOUL PT 7
item.description:
ROCKSTEADY ROCK MY SOUL PART 7
Hello, here’s another podcast in the rocksteady series. I hope you enjoy it, leave a comment if you feel so inclined. To those who download these podcasts from itunes, if you’re getting a ‘this person is too tight to pay for more bandwidth’ type message try getting it from the address  smilingirl.podomatic.com. Also, if you want to, you can listen to deleted podcasts on mixcloud (user name smilingirl) Hey Ron, this one’s for you x One love, Smilin, x
Track List 01 Prince Buster - sit and wonder 02 Slim Smith - please stay 03 Junior Soul - glendevon special 04 Beverleys Allstars – double action 05 Derrick Morgan - greedy girl 06 Yvonne Harrison -the chase 07 The Coolers - my heart is aching 08 Prince Buster - dancing time 09 Errol Dunkley - you're gonna need me 10 Joe Higgs - neighbour neighbour 11 Bobby Aitken - orange street special 12 The Pioneers - give it to me 13 Winston Heywood - i'll never fall in love with you again 14 Derrick Morgan - no dice 15 The Bases - ease up 16 Soul Brothers - hot and cold 17 Lyn Taitt and the Jets - move up 18 Prince Buster – human 19 Rudy Mills - i'm trapped 20 Errol Dunkley - seek and you'll find

item.title: old time dance
item.description:
Old time dance
Bandwidth has reset time to bring back the old time dance again. For those of you that fancy listening to older podcasts that have been deleted go straight to http://www.mixcloud.com/smilingirl/ where you’ll find some of them. Leave a comment if you feel so inclined. Cheers, one big love, Smilin
Bring back the old time dance…………….
1 Mungo’s HiFi ft Mikey Murka – old time dance 2 Early B – bible story 3 Ranking Joe – a dread earthquake 4 Fantan Mojah – so many problems 5 Josey Wales – rocking time 6 Josey Wales – preacher man 7 Buccaneer – neighbourhood 8 Yt, Blackout JA, Mr Williamz, Michie One – bills 9 Lt Stitchie – fresh sexy chicken 10 Kiprich - joe grind 11 Tanya Stevens – mi an mi god 12 Pliers – bam bam 13 Frankie Paul – dem a go feel it 14 Brigadier Jerry – everybody bawling 15 Sugar Roy – lawman 16 General Degree – Thanks and praises 17 Lutan Fyah – culture dem 18 Cocoa Tea – long time 19 Junior Kelly - deeper

item.title: big sound
item.description:
With a bit of mixup and version excursion this podcast is inspired by the big sound that is the King Elijah Sound - hope you like it Dukie.
Track List
1 Toots and the Maytals – 54-46 - intro 2 Gappy Ranks – pumpkin belly - intro 3 Toots and the Maytals – 54-46 4 Gappy Ranks – pumpkin belly 5 Loud Disturbance Crew – 50 pound riddim (dub mix) 6 Joseph Cotton – wicked running 7 Universal Speakers – cool now 8 Jackie Mittoo and the Soul Vendors – drum song 9 Jack Radics – fill it with love 10 Gappy Ranks – mountain top 11 Anju and Flourgon - big sound 12 Buju Banton – hold me tight 13 Ann Mason ft Little Mac and the Boss Sounds - you can't love me 14 The Soul Vendors - ringo rock 15 Courtney John - ready to go 16 Major Lazer ft Mr Vegas - can't stop now 17 Jackie Brown – blue version 18 ? – tribute to K T 19 King Tubby – heavenly dub 20 Anthony B – ungrateful 21 Buju Banton – sensimellia persecution 22 Richie Spice - high grade in my chalice 23 Myrna Thousand Allstars – golden skank

item.title: Running Back
item.description:
Running back
Having had yet another hard drive melt down, and then a massive wait for bandwidth to reset I’ve now come running back to present you with another podcast. No particular theme, just a load of favourites. Leave a comment if you feel so inclined.
One love. X
Track list
1 Billy Dice and the Untouchables – fari version 2 Barrington Spence – running back version 3 Roman Stewart – you wont see me 4 Dave Barker and the Techniques – lonely man 5 The Deltones – I’ll take you there 6 Bob Marley and the Wailers – stir it up (rocksteady version) 7 Prince Buster – hit me back 8 Dave Barker – set me free 9 The Bleechers – come into my parlour 10 The Ethiopians – hail rasta, brother hail 11 The Paragons – mercy mercy 12 The Beltones – home without you 13 Nellie – you send me 14 Carey Johnson and the Sound Dimension – musical scorcher 15 The Tidals – how glad I am 16 Justin Hinds – carry go bring come 17 The Melodians – come on little girl 18 Lloyd Young – soup 19Freddy McKay and Prince Junior – picture on the wall version three

item.title: special brew (aka fricsan follies)
item.description: SPECIAL BREW aka FRICSAN FOLLIES We love djing at the Fricsan (http://www.thesnowdoninn.co.uk/) everyone is so friendly, the atmosphere is great, they love dancing and they enjoy ska and two tone, so this podcast is for (and inspired by) the Fricsan posse (you know who you are!!) WE LOVE YOU - YES WE DO. If you ever come to Snowdonia go and camp in their fields, fish in their river and spend money at the bar. Special Brew 1 Bad Manners - special brew 2 Don Drummond - cool smoke 3 Ernie Freeman - dumplin's 4 Byron Lee and the Dragonaires – dumplins 5 Dr Ring-Ding and the Senior Allstars - madness 6 The Soul Vendors - ringo rock 7 Johnny Osbourne - rude boy skank 8 The English Beat - whine and grine-stand down margaret 9 The Skatalites - nimble foot 10 The Raving Ravers - rock rock and cry 11 The Bodysnatchers - people get ready 12 No 1 Station - boss beat 13 The Aggrolites - grave digger 14 Amy Winehouse - you're wondering now 15 Prince Buster - enjoy yourself Also, please take time to check out the podcast archive which can be found at http://smilinsarchive.blogspot.com/ Thanks very much.

item.title: cor blimey missus
item.description: Sorry this has been a long time coming. A whole heap of naughtyness for you this time, unless you don't mind answering questions from your young children ('dad, what's a buddy and why's it dead?') it's best to listen to this podcast in the company of adults. Track List 01 - Phyllis Dillon - don't touch me tomato 02 - Jackie Opal - push wood 03 - Desmond Dekker - soldering 04 - Dawn Love - watering 05 - Prince Williams - action wood 06 - Max Romeo & Burt Reynolds - a wet scene 07 - Nora Dean - night food reggae 08 - Cynthia Cooper - three minute man 09 - Cock & Puss - dead buddy 10 - Leo Graham - greedy gal 11 - Yvette Vaccianna - tralala boom de yay 12 - George Grosset - no money 13 - Flowers & Alvin - in a de pum pum 14 - Lord Flowers - pudding pan 15 - Madame Sexy - buddy cry 16 - Jackie Brown - jelly water 17 - The Ethiopians - want gal

item.title: Baby I've been missing you
item.description:
A Happy New Year to all of you and all of yours, I hope you’ll all be happy, healthy and feel loved.
For those of you looking for podcasts that have been deleted you will find them on here http://smilinsarchive.blogspot.com/

item.title: rocksteady rock my soul part 6
item.description:
Rocksteady Rock My Soul Part 6
It’s no secret that I love rocksteady, a rocking bass line and sweet sweet vocals, nothing better. Rock back and enjoy 20 fabulous rocksteady tunes, from me for you.
Tracklist:
1 Ken Parker - a change is gonna come 2 The Coolers - my heart is aching 3 Owen Grey - i'm gonna take you back 4 The Vibrators - cool water 5 Bobby and Val - one way street 6 Prince Buster - love oh love 7 The Mellotones - fat girl in red 8 Larry Marshall - got a new girl 9 Marshall Williams - norwegian wood 10 Bobby Ellis and the Desmond Miles Seven - the emperor 11 Toots and the Maytals - 54 46 that's my number 12 Lloyd Clarke - summertime 13 Rudy Mills – a place called happiness 14 The Mellotones - nonesuch bust me bet 15 Jojo Bennett – cantelope rock 16 Winston and Robin - bad mind grudgeful 17 Cannon and The Soul Vendors - bad treatment 18 Rudy Mills - a long story 19 Rita Marley and the Soulettes - my desire 20 Delano Stewart - tell me baby

item.title: Financial Crisis
item.description:
Financial crisis
I can’t believe this has not been done already, but here goes; here we have an hour long a musical commentary on the current credit crunch/financial crisis/worst economic thing to happen in the last 70 years. At the end of this podcast are a couple of suggestions for a solution to the economic meltdown. We could, as the Silvertones suggest and have a little faith and put our trust in Jah, or we could follow the suggestions made by Derrick Morgan swiftly followed by the same suggestion made by U Brown.
If you do have any spare dollars, cents, euros or pence wearing holes in your pockets feel free to use the ‘please donate’ button provided on this page by PayPal ;-D
Here’s the track list............
1 The miracles – money 2 Jimmy Witherspoon - money's gettin' cheaper 3 Willie Jones – where’s my money 4 Al & The Vibrators - money or love 5 Barrett Strong – money 6 Jumbo Sterling - slave driver 7 Marcia Griffiths – working 8 Slim Smith - rougher yet 9 Laurel Aitken - landlords & tenants 10 The Ethiopians - everything crash 11 Bill Gentles - take the rod 12 Tito Simon - money hard to come by 13 Delroy Wilson – money 14 Shelton Walks - no money no friend 15 Enos McLeod - money worries 16 Barry Biggs - work all day 17 Owen Gray- ain’t got no money 18 George Grossett - no money no love 19 The Silvertones - financial crisis 20 Derrick Morgan - people's decision 21 U Brown - manners
one love x

item.title: The Great Roy Shirley
item.description:
The Great Roy Shirley
Roy Shirley has recently passed away; here is a brief celebration of his works. Please excuse the scratchy but catchy ones.

item.title: boogie in my bones part 5
item.description: Boogie in my bones part 5 Yet again it’s time to get your dancing shoes on and wear your carpet out. Grab a partner and swing along to this collection of swing, r’n’b, rockabilly, ska and funk. I hope you enjoy it, as usual, feel free to leave a comment. x Track List 1 Louis Jordan - choo choo ch'boogie 2 Bull Moose Jackson - big ten-inch record 3 Big Jack Reynolds - you made it up in your mind 4 Charlie Organaire - merry twist 5 Bob Gaddy - slow down baby 6 Clive Wilson - one ska, one ounce of weed, one beer 7 Jackie Edwards - sea cruise 8 Earl Hooker - frog hop 9 Clint Miller - bertha lou 10 Redd Stewart - brother drop dead 11 Big Mama Thornton & Johnny Ace - yes baby 12 Lord Brynner - fire fire 13 Prince Buster - 30 pieces of silver 14 Sound Studio Band - give me some 15 The Dynamics - land of a 1000 dances 16 The Cimmarons - street walk 17 Poindexter Brothers - backfield in motion 18 Betty Lavette -I Feel Good (All Over)

item.itunes:summary:
Boogie in my bones part 5
Yet again it’s time to get your dancing shoes on and wear your carpet out. Grab a partner and swing along to this collection of swing, r’n’b, rockabilly, ska and funk. I hope you enjoy it, as usual, feel free to leave a comment. x
Track List
1 Louis Jordan - choo choo ch'boogie 2 Bull Moose Jackson - big ten-inch record 3 Big Jack Reynolds - you made it up in your mind 4 Charlie Organaire - merry twist 5 Bob Gaddy - slow down baby 6 Clive Wilson - one ska, one ounce of weed, one beer 7 Jackie Edwards - sea cruise 8 Earl Hooker - frog hop 9 Clint Miller - bertha lou 10 Redd Stewart - brother drop dead 11 Big Mama Thornton & Johnny Ace - yes baby 12 Lord Brynner - fire fire 13 Prince Buster - 30 pieces of silver 14 Sound Studio Band - give me some 15 The Dynamics - land of a 1000 dances 16 The Cimmarons - street walk 17 Poindexter Brothers - backfield in motion 18 Betty Lavette -I Feel Good (All Over)

item.title: Champion Sound
item.description:
Champion sound
This episode is in response to a friend who said ‘don’t hear much 80’s stuff anymore’. Here by popular demand and special request is a selection of scratchy but catchy 80’s tunes with a little bit of dj (toasting!! Remember that!!) a little bit of dub and a little bit of ragga. I have included the label or album title and the date this time, as I was asked. So Chris, let’s hope this hits the spot
Track List
1 Nicodemus - gunman connection (cha cha 12'', 1981) 2 Toyan - dance and romance (midnight rock 12'' dj edit, 1981) 3 Johnny Ringo - rub a dub style (observer 12'', 1979) 4 Tristan Palma & Jah Thomas reggae taking over & feeding of the 5000 (midnight rock 12'' 1981) 5 Papa Biggie - youth them have to grow (General For All General lp, 1983) 6 Jah Mike - crucial (Leroy Smart with Roots Radix & Friends lp 1983) 7 Colin Roach - champion sound (jammys 7'' 1987) 8 I Roy - music in my head (The Lyrics Man lp 1989) 9 Queen Paula - move up (digital 7'' 1989) 10 Steely & Cleevie - market sound (version) 11 Admiral Bailey - no way no better than yard [jammys 7'' 1988) 12 Horseman - country gal (jammys 7'' 1988) 13 General Trees - horseman style (jammys 7'' 198*) 14 Josey Wales - leggo mi hand gateman (volcano 7'' 1983)

item.title: pour on the sauce
item.description:
Back to reggae for this episode. A whole heap of oldies ranging from rocksteady to dj style. the tunes are selected according to the 'oooo, thats good, not heard that in ages' criteria.
1 The Soul Leaders – pour on the sauce 2 Tommy McCook – billy joe 3 Dennis Alcapone & John Holt – jumping jack 4 Max Romeo – wet dream 5 The soul Leaders – mothers advice 6 Dave Collins – my heart cries out 7 Ken Parker – i should have known 8 Lloyd Charmers & The Hippy Boys – yes sah 9 Eric Donaldson – aint too proud to beg 10 The Gladiators – ungrateful girl (aka untrue girl) 11 Johnny Clarke – rock with me baby 12 Rupert Martin – pyjama thief (dj version) 13 I Roy – step right up 14 Scotty – come back and stay version 15 Carl Malcolm – miss wire waist 16 Derrick Morgan – what’s your grouse 17 Danny D & The Shadows – lord a masie masie
sit back and enjoy. As always, feel free to leave a comment.

item.title: rock away my blues
item.description: Rock away my blues Finally the sun has arrived, spring has sprung and the birds are singing, get on those rocking shoes and dance away your blues! Those who know me will have a giggle at the name of the artist on the first track, apologies to whoever it was that made the brilliant mash up (track 8) try as i might i can’t find your name to acknowledge you (maybe mike divine aka hibrid http://devinemashup.blogspot.com). Anyway turn it up loud and dace round your kitchen to rock away my blues........... Tracklist 1 Sandra Peters - rock away my blues 2 Tiny Grimes - juicy fruit 3 Hattie Littles - love, trouble, heartache & misery 4 Nicky Thomas - soul power 5 Kabanjak Meets Protassov - cruise control 6 Wee Willie & The Winners - i don't know what you got but i know what you need 7 The Soul Directions - su, su, su 8 Django Returns Clapping (aka clap clap djangos back) 9 Laurel Aitken - heile heile(the lion) 10 Joe Zawinul - mercy mercy mercy 11 Joe Payne - sweet thang 12 Eddie Roland - take me in your arms 13 Carlos & The Bandidos - fever 14 Laurel Aitken - sahara 15 The Marvelettes - the boy from crosstown 16 The Mohawks - baby hold on 17 Joe White & Chuck - any time 18 Lloyd Charmers & The Hippy Boys - house in session

item.title: Inspired by...........
item.description: Inspired by......... Natty Bo and Ska Cubano who played at Hendre Hall recently. The place was jumping and if you ever get the opportunity to see Ska Cubano grab it with both hands. As you can see from the photo Natty Bo jumped on the decks after the show (thanks Vashti for the photo, hello Dewi) and treated us to some fabulous jump up swing and r’n’b. Time to get your dancing shoes on once again! Track List 1 Roy Newman & the Boys – sadie green the vamp from new Orleans 2 Jumpin' Joe Williams with Red Saunders & His Orchestra - hey bartender give that man a drink 3 Hadda Brooks - jump back honey 4 Macbeth The Great –man smart, woman smarter 5 Count Lasher – calypso cha cha cha 6 Lord Power - let's do it 7 Chin’s Calypso Quintet – night food 8 Lord Tanamo - night food ska 9 Lord Creator - big bamboo 10 The Skatalites - latin goes ska 11 Lloyd Clarke - japanese girl 12 Eric Morris - number one 13 Jamaica Allstars - alipang instrumental 14 Los De Abajo – Jericho 15 Butumbaba - rocksteady times 16 The Hong Kong Gang - reggae mento 17 Jeffrey Brown - ska-ing version

item.title: Hot Buttered Dub Part 2
item.description:
Hot Buttered Dub Part 2
Part two of hot buttered dub brings you 45 minutes of tremendous Jamaican 70’s dubs and versions. If you are interested, you can find part one at http://www.subnav.com . Sit back and enjoy.
Track list
1 Charlie Ace - hot buttered dub intro 2 Chariot Riders - solomon instrumental version 3 Prince Allah - stone version 4 World Wide Allstars - half past the hour 5 Tappa Zukie – mpla version 6 Delroy Wilson - beating version 7 Aggrovators -version ( Johnny Clarke - Love Your Brothers & Sisters) 8 G G Allstars - part two dub (equal rights) 9 Revolutionaries - shank i dub 10 The Groove Master - silver bird (Instrumental) 11 Lloyd Young - jah jah know version 12 G G Allstars - hold my hand pt2 13 King Tubby - get ready version 14 Sky Nation - peace version 15 Black Beard & The Pirates - stop version 16 Barry's Allstars - girl in dub

item.title: It's Soul Time
item.description: Soul Time! This podcast is dedicated to all them soul boys and soul girls who are busy booking babysitters, shining the leather on their dancing shoes, buying johnsons baby powder and anti-perspirant and generally getting themselves ‘sorted’ for the big weekend coming up in Prestatyn. This is just 20 or so tunes to get you all in the mood. Track List 1 Jackie Wilson - soul time 2 Darrell Banks - open the door to your heart 3 Azie Mortimer - you can't take it away 4 Jimmy James - this heart of mine 5 Darrel Banks - angel baby 6 Billie Davis - just walk in my shoes 7 Bobby Sheen - dr love 8 Darlene Love - long way to be happy 9 Jimmy James & the Vagabonds - i feel alright 10 Denise Lasalle - keep it coming 11 Ronnie Milsap - ain't no soul (left in these ole shoes) 12 Kenny Bernard - ain't no soul 13 Joe Matthews - sorry ain't good enough 14 Billy Hambric - she said goodbye 15 Jackie Wilson - i get the sweetest feeling 16 Inez Foxx - you don't want my love 17 Gaylettes - heartache's i can't take 18 Soul Sisters - good time tonight 19 Owen Gray - can i get a witness 20 Edwin Starr - my weakness is you 21 Geno Washington - she shot a hole in my soul 22 Mary Wells - let yourself go

item.title: I Feel The Music
item.description: I feel the music Firstly, I’d like to send out a big big thank you to the people who have generously donated dollars and cents over the Christmas period. Secondly, here’s a selection of early reggae, with a sprinkling of rocksteady, for your listening and dancing pleasure, sit back and enjoy tunes that are ‘crisper than cornflakes’. 1 Roy Smith - i feel the music 2 Carey & Lloyd - come down pt.1 3 The Cables - feel all right 4 The Royals - never see come see 5 Laurel Aitken - can't turn your back on me 6 Delroy Wilson - run run 07 ? (it’s a Trojan B side?) - walk on by 8 Rupies Allstars - look who a bust style 9 The Dynamic Boys - shock attack 10 Rupie Edwards - scout 11 Slim smith + Roy Shirley - facts of life 12 Keith MacCarthy - everybody rude now + version 13 Owen Grey - don't leave me never 14 Delano Stewart - stay a little bit longer 15 Ken Parker - my whole world is falling down 16 Slim Smith - ain't too proud to beg Don’t be shy – leave a comment. One Love x

item.title: Ain't that a groove
item.description:
Ain’t that a groove
I hope you enjoy this mixture of r&b, boogaloo, soul, ska, reggae and bluebeat, it definitely is a groove. As always my advice to you is to play this very loud, roll up the rug, get on your dancing shoes go on i dare you, disturb your neighbours!!
One love x
1 James Brown - ain't that a groove 2 Yvonne Fair - say yeah yeah 3 Errol Dixon - morning train 4 The Sugar Plums -too much 5 Derrick Morgan & Desmond Dekker - (what a) revenge 6 Dave Mitchell & The Screamers - trip 7 El Rico, Collins, J Satch - shocksteady 8 ASPO - night doctor 9 Ska Cubano -cindad dormida 10 Eddie Daye - i can fix it 11 Laurel Aitken - if it's the money you need 12 Roland Alphonso - rinky dink 13 The Soul Leaders - beauty is only skin deep 14 Desmond Dekker & The Aces - i've got the blues 15 Bo Diddley - i can tell 16 Billy Emerson - whip 17 The Soul Brothers - something else 18 Jackie Opal -done with a friend 19 A.C. Reed – boogaloo tramp 20 Eddie Wilson - shing-a-ling stroll

item.title: something completely different
item.description: Something completely different. As it says in the title this podcast is something completely different from all my other podcasts, it’s an eclectic mixture of tunes from around the world, plus a few fabulous remixes just for a bit of a change. Thank you for listening, all comments gratefully received. (turn it up loud Johnti!!) item.title: boogie in my bones part 4
item.description:
Boogie in my bones part 4 I thought i’d got this boogie stuff out of my system, but thanks to your requests the flame has been rekindled. Here’s another bunch of soul stompers, funk, r&b, ska and reggae for your listening pleasure. Roll up the rug, grab a partner and have a dance........... and the beat goes on.................
1 Darrell banks - open the door to your heart 2 Evelyn Thomas – weakspot 3 Ska Cubano - soy campesino 4 Bill Allen - please give me something 5 Barrett Strong – money 6 Jimmy Cliff - gold digger 7 King Sporty - DJ special 8 The Mar Keys - last night 9 Sharon Jones - got to be the way it is 10 Leroy and the Drivers - the sad chicken 11 Jimmy Robins - i can't please you 12 Wilson Pickett - 634-5789 13 The Dingle Brothers – 6345789 14 Leon Wint - when your down 15 Buster's Allstars - 127 orange street 16 The Blues Blasters - chariot rock 17 Noble Watts - great times 18 Rockin Saints - cheat on me baby 19 Buddy Rich - the beat goes on

item.title: i love the reggae!
item.description:
I love the reggae!
I apologise 1, for the lack of podcasts and 2, for the sound quality; it’s all been due to a hard drive melt down and the subsequent month and a half reloading tunes and learning how to get vista to work how I want it to. Whinge aside i’m back on the case so here’s 19 top tunes to get you up on your feet. I love the reggae! (does anyone read this??)
1 the tenors – i love the reggae 2 clives allstars - san Sebastian 3 cynthia Richards - conversation 4 shirley and the rude boys – jumping around 5 prince buster's all stars - love each other 6 jackie and soul vendors -baba boom version 7 eric donaldson – lonely nights 8 typhoon allstars – rack-a-tack 9 the pyramids – prisoner of alkatraz 10 the pyramids – shotgun 11 richard saunders – sign of the times 12 stranger cole – happy go lucky 13 the pyramids – stingo 14 seven letters – the fit 15 the upsetters – night doctor 16 the silvertones – it’s real 17 dillinger – skanking 18 earl chinna smith - riding with mr lee 19 slim smith – my conversation
